context: The production of monoclonal antibodies against conventional antigens is already standardized using the hybridoma technique. Monoclonal antibodies binding hapten molecules however can still be difficult to produce since haptens do not trigger an immune response themselves. Induction of immune responses requires conjugation of the haptens to immunogenic carrier proteins. The hapten Leukotriene B4 (LTB4) is a lipid mediator that belongs to the group of eicosanoids (bioactive, 20 carbon-containing compounds). It is biosynthesized from arachidonic acid which is mainly stored within membrane phospholipids. Upon cell activation arachidonic acid is released and converted into LTB4 with the help of two enzymes: 5-lipoxygenase and leukotriene A4 hydrolase. LTB4 plays an important role in different inflammatory processes.
